align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="2050279"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=2050279#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2037683" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2037683" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="PerfumedParrot"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/90056"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.90056.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="PerfumedParrot" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Cuir-Beluga-1019.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1019.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cuir Bluga"title="Cuir Bluga"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2037683ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2037683" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/90056">PerfumedParrot</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-21">01/21/24 13:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I live about 50 minutes walking distance to a Le Labo, so I took my dog to go smell Lavande 31. I hadnt realised that the new Myrrh 55 is only available in Shanghai until September so Ill just have to wait for that one. <br />
Lavende 31 is beautiful and so easy to wear. Its less lavender but more bergamot with musk on me. Its a fuzzy, citric musk thats slightly spicy from the herbaceous lavender. The dry-down brings an  aquatic nature which is reminiscent many many classic mens colognes. Its innocent, pure and neutral in attitude, so its a really easy wear for any carefree occasion. This is a perfect buy for more fathers/grandfathers who prefer the traditional cologne styles, as its modernised but still timeless.<br />
If you like those Woods of Windsor or Santa Maria Novella type soliflore soap fragrances done in an apothecary style but with a modern twist of Le Labo magic, this is the one.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="2037683"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=2037683#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2026710" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Longevity is good but not strong in sillage.<br />
Reminds me of jpg Fleur du male.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="2014456"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=2014456#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2011325" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I finally got the full size for my birthday and since then I've been wearing it nonstop. It is super clean and perfect as a signature everyday wear. I'm not a huge fan of lavender but this is such a special lavender mixed with neroli and musk that I just got hooked on this one. My first Le Labo scent and can't wait to get to smell the next one.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="2011325"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=2011325#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2010014" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2007340" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Buckstermonkey"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1275314"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1275314.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Buckstermonkey" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2007340ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2007340" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1275314">Buckstermonkey</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-21">12/21/23 14:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Wonderful. Not your usual Lavender scent. For that check out Czech and Speakes Oxford &amp; Cambridge. This is very special though.  Clean, fresh and soapy. My favourite scent buy of 2023</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="2007340"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=2007340#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2001053" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2001053" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Antoine_Doinel"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1401865"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1401865.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Antoine_Doinel" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Frederic-Malle/Musc-Ravageur-1801.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1801.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Musc Ravageur"title="Musc Ravageur"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2001053ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2001053" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1401865">Antoine_Doinel</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-14">12/14/23 07:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I rather trusted Le Labo to come out with an interesting lavender without falling into the cutesy Provencal or barber style that usually bothers me, and here I am not disappointed, they manage to reinvent it, between modernity and classicism. Here this usually thunderous and talkative note which tends to occupy all the attention, tends to fade while remaining structuring in a balancing act with the bergamot-neroli couple, initially it is ultimately the medicinal character (this is not at all a fault for me) of this flower which expresses itself and persists. With evolution, classic lavandin is more present, in the register of being very clean, elegant and very easy to wear, without falling completely into Provenal soap, with a touch of singularity. In the jeans - white t-shirt category it is perfect.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="2001053"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=2001053#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1994089" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1994089" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ButterGoose"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1917307"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="ButterGoose" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1994089ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1994089" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1917307">ButterGoose</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-06">12/06/23 11:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Received a sample of this and really didnt think much, but then I kept catching irresistible notes of it throughout the day and I was hooked. I ordered a 50ml bottle which arrived within a couple of days. I decided to wear it to work and have never received more compliments and questions about what I was wearing. While perfumes are very subjective and project differently on different people, this one really works on me; it projects well without being too strong and lasts for hours. Its clean and comforting, yet a bit sexy and intriguing. I own Santal 33, Rose 31, Lys 41 and Neroli 36- none come close to the perfection of Lavande 31</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1994089"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1994089#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1988670" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1988670" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Tys0n"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1042904"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1042904.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Tys0n" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfum-d-Empire/Vetiver-Bourbon-76536.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.76536.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vetiver Bourbon"title="Vetiver Bourbon"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1988670ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1988670" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1042904">Tys0n</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-29">11/29/23 23:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>While Lavande 31 is not without its merits, one needs to ask if one really wants to smell like a hotel restroom.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1988670"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1988670#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1988435" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1988435" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="roanyoke"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1489307"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1489307.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="roanyoke" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Xerjoff/Lira-11801.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.11801.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lira"title="Lira"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1988435ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1988435" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1489307">roanyoke</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-29">11/29/23 15:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Clean without being too sharp. I would call it a barber shop fragrance if the lavender wasn't so fresh. I really want to smell this on a man.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1988435"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1988435#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1980698" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1980698" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Dylan Lim"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1708672"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Dylan Lim" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1980698ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1980698" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1708672">Dylan Lim</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-20">11/20/23 00:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a very simplistic soapy scent, done in a niche way. The scent opens up with bergamot and neroli, and takes on a very soapy DNA, which I would say is in the Prada L'homme style of soapy fragrances, being floral, citrus, clean scents. The drydown is magnificent, with a soapy lavender, and the base note of musk starting to come thru. The scent stays a fresh soapy clean scent throughout, and I think this signature worthy, or at least can be used for everyday use, in spring and fall. This could very well be one of Le Labo's best creations, and is definitely going to be one of my signatures.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1980698"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1980698#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1973820" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1973820" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="reesefernando"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1695584"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1695584.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="reesefernando" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jo-Malone-London/Musk-Memento-Cologne-90257.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.90257.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Musk Memento Cologne"title="Musk Memento Cologne"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1973820ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1973820" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1695584">reesefernando</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-10">11/10/23 22:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Beautiful scent! Upon spraying this, I immediately smelled my top 3 favorite notes - lavender, neroli and bergamot - so it was a no-brainer buy for me. It is a fresh, happy and relaxing scent, which reminds me of weekend mornings when I have no work stress to think about and I can be myself all day. At the drydown, the lavender becomes more apparent in a soapy skin scent way and the tonka beans kick in to add a calming vibe. Gorgeous! Projection and longevity are both good and way better than my Le Labo fave Another 13. <br />
<br />
I was really surprised to see low ratings and bad reviews for this but as a freshie lover, this has easily climbed to my shelf of favorites and blind reach bottles.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1973820"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1973820#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1966499" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1966499" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Angelov1314"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1542388"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1542388.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Angelov1314" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1966499ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1966499" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1542388">Angelov1314</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-01">11/01/23 23:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>More affordable version of bigarade 18</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1966499"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1966499#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1965930" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1965930" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lessthanzero"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1512520"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1512520.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lessthanzero" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Narciso-Rodriguez/Narciso-Rodriguez-For-Him-Eau-de-Parfum-Intense-14741.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.14741.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Narciso Rodriguez For Him Eau de Parfum Intense"title="Narciso Rodriguez For Him Eau de Parfum Intense"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1965930ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1965930" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1512520">lessthanzero</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-01">11/01/23 09:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very nice! Some people have said it's more neroli than lavender, but I get a big, big, big velvety lavender here. Smells quite natural - I can almost picture that powdery/oily sensation of handling real lavender florets, and crumbling them between your fingers. It's very bright and clean in the opening, but it settles to a heavier than expected scent. Way more grounded and earthy than anything from the "Aqua" line of MFK, for example.<br />
<br />
Lavender hued, velvety, sweet, milky, metallic, a little green, fresh, sagebrush. Down the line unisex. Not a fougere. Extremely well done. No perfumer listed, but smells a bit like something Maurice Roucel would do. Good performance too!<br />
<br />
4/5</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1965930"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1965930#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1965809" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1965809" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Formula1"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/950515"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Formula1" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1965809ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1965809" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/950515">Formula1</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-01">11/01/23 06:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It incredible how subjective fragrance is. I think this is one of the best that I have smelled from Le Labo. I got a sample from them. It smells very clean and I do pick up on the lavender eventually. It just smells really good and I got about 8 hours longevity from it on my skin. The projection was arms length so not bad. My teenage daughter who normally could care less about any fragrance I wear actually said it smelled good as I walked by. Seems like this will get some compliments. I see wearing this for any occasion and any time of year.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1965809"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1965809#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1963923" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1963923" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Scratch &amp; Sniff"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1878218"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1878218.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Scratch &amp; Sniff" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1963923ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1963923" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1878218">Scratch &amp; Sniff</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-29">10/29/23 19:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>An utter disappointment from the house of Le Labo.<br />
<br />
I was looking forward to this and was hopeful for a unique lavender scent, but all I could smell was neroli with only the faintest whisper of lavender an hour later.  This would be ironic, since they already have Neroli 36, but then again the genius trickery of Le Labo has always been that you can't necessarily expect the juice to smell like what the label says.  <br />
<br />
If you wish to smell of nothing more ambitious than boring fresh linens and citrusy laundry detergent then have at it, but you would be grossly overpaying.  Please aim a bit higher next time, Le Labo.<br />
<br />
In five words or less: Neroli. Neroli. Neroli.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1963923"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1963923#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1962845" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1962845" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="JoeMacchiato"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/441736"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.441736.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="JoeMacchiato" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/Ylang-49-18383.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.18383.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ylang 49"title="Ylang 49"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1962845ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1962845" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/441736">JoeMacchiato</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-28">10/28/23 07:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It is indeed a lavender scent, make no mistake, which is based on a slightly soapy/clean musk drydown. There is nothing to write home about. <br />
<br />
If you're looking for a unique lavender scent, try CHANEL's Boy(Lavandula angustifolia, aka true lavender)/Jersey(musky), Penhaligon's Satorial(a steamy haberdashery shop), MFK's Masculin Pluriel(spicy), Dior's Eau Noire(twin sister of Masculin Pluriel but raw and spicier; original, not sure about the new version), SL's Gris Clair(smokey, incense-y).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1962845"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1962845#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1962555" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1962555" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Salandria828"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1697913"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1697913.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Salandria828" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/Rose-31-3678.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3678.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rose 31"title="Rose 31"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1962555ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1962555" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1697913">Salandria828</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-27">10/27/23 18:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>For me, Lavande 31 was a straight-up disappointment. I was excited to try this blend of some of my favorite scent notes (namely lavender and neroli), supposedly with an unconventional, modern spin, but once it became clear that this scent got worse the longer it sat on my skin, I couldnt wash it off fast enough. <br />
<br />
Ill lead with the fact that Im not super well-versed in the subtleties and nuances of building fragrances or of analyzing them, but my basic impression of Lavande 31 is that its top-heavy with ephemeral top and middle notes in need of a better underpinning of bottom notes. <br />
<br />
Right out of the bottle, I got a fairly pleasant blast of citrus and neroli with the faintest hint of lavender along with some of those much-touted soapy and astringent notes. The lavender note was the first to disappear on the dry down; the neroli was next, then the rest of the citrusy soapiness. After about 15 minutes, all that was left was an odd powdery note lying atop a sharp chemical smell that Ive come to know as Le Labos olfactory signature.  What I mean by this is that the overwhelming majority of their fragrances dry down on me into a similar unpleasant, synthetic, eternal smell that makes my eyes water and my nose run until I finally get it scrubbed off my skin. Perhaps these are the intended bottom notes of the fragrance, but instead, it comes across to me as a blend of synthetic ingredients there to bolster the longevity of the scent, rather than to serve as intended scent notes. To be clear, Im not knocking well-placed synthetic ingredients in perfume, but whatever is going on here is utterly unpleasant and by far the most enduring note of this fragrance.   <br />
<br />
The lavender in this fragrance is merely a wink and a nod to this fragrances namesake, which further reinforces my distaste for Le Labos heavy-handed pretentiousness when it comes to reinventing scent profiles. I was hoping for something that took lavender in an unusual, hopefully intriguing if not pleasant, direction. Instead, it was little more than about 15 minutes worth of drugstore cologne followed up by a generic sharp, lingering, allergy-triggering stink on my skin. Ergo, Lavande 31 is a hard no for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1962555"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1962555#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1962326" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1962326" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="nonikocci"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1729420"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="nonikocci" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1962326ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1962326" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1729420">nonikocci</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-27">10/27/23 12:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If you already have Bigarade 18, you can skip this. This is essentially a citrus top with a mid/lavender. If you wanted to have an aromatic to your Bigarade, try this. Overall, very pleasant citrus top with lavender punches. The lavender is the type that you normally get, it's not overpowering and it's not the cozy one. It gives off hotel vibes, a hotel might like to use this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1962326"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1962326#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1961784" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1961784" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="violeteme"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1387189"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1387189.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="violeteme" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Sisley/Sisley-Eau-de-3-5852.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.5852.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sisley Eau de 3"title="Sisley Eau de 3"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1961784ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1961784" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1387189">violeteme</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-26">10/26/23 20:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm sorry, but it is straight up cheap wc air-freshener. We all know this type. It doesn't truly matter if it's in Le Labo bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1961784"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1961784#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1961337" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1961337" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sam.newman"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1241735"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1241735.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sam.newman" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1961337ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1961337" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1241735">sam.newman</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-26">10/26/23 07:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Prada Amber Pour Homme much? Literally spend $50 on Prada over this!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1961337"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1961337#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1960352" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1960352" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="quiltedduck"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1838796"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1838796.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="quiltedduck" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/Another-13-10131.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.10131.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Another 13"title="Another 13"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1960352ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1960352" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1838796">quiltedduck</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-25">10/25/23 05:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>When we first moved into the house my parents built in 2006 my brother and I were not allowed to go upstairs because there were no banisters. Once they were installed, we were both excited to have our own rooms, but more excited to have a separate room for video games. My uncle had this disgusting old white rug and horrid burgundy wine couch that he gave us for the play space around this time. The first Halo and Lego Star Wars games came out on Xbox and my brother and I spent hours on end in the play space on that couch, on that rug playing those games. <br />
I could never figure out what this smell was or where it was coming from. It was powdery, musty, and sweet and reminded me of a cleaning product but I had never smelled a cleaning product like it before. I assumed my mom or grandmother had sprayed the room or the couch since they were so gross. That couch stuck around in that room for two whole decades until I graduated college and moved into my first house. I was desperate so I took the free putrid couch and the rug still lives at my parents. For the first month or so after moving into my post-degree house, you could still smell the strange powdery cleaning product smell. Ive eventually gave the couch away to another desperate graduate from the same university who finished just a semester after me.<br />
When I apply this fragrance, all of these memories come flooding back to me in a postimpressionist style faded painting of a memory. Im not exactly sure what in the fragrance does this, but I know it has something to do with the lavender. Ive had similar experiences with other lavender products in the past. I wonder if mustiness from the old furniture mixed with a lavender room spray is what harmonized perfectly for this fragrance to trigger such a strong flashback. <br />
Despite the ickiest moments I had with that furniture, I enjoy wearing this fragrance. Its always pleasant when a scent transports you to those subtle and lighthearted moments.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1960352"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1960352#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1960335" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1960335" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Sniffing Gorilla"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1456636"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Sniffing Gorilla" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1960335ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1960335" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1456636">Sniffing Gorilla</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-25">10/25/23 05:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Definitely Bigarade 18 flanker with a whiff of lavender. Whats wrong with Le labo creative lately? Myrrhe 55 and now this? Totally disappointed!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1960335"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1960335#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1958551" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1958551" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="kitkat_69"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1551305"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="kitkat_69" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/The-Different-Company/Majaina-Sin-46800.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.46800.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Majana Sin"title="Majana Sin"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1958551ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1958551" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1551305">kitkat_69</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-22">10/22/23 19:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells so good and elegant! I got a sampler, and I feel so posh wearing it. It doesn't smell like most lavender perfumes, it's fresher and a little soapy. I wish it wasn't so expensive, otherwise I'd totally have a full bottle. Good dupe suggestions will be very appreciated!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1958551"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1958551#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1958529" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1958529" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="BostonScentGuy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1052452"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="BostonScentGuy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1958529ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1958529" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1052452">BostonScentGuy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-22">10/22/23 18:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Hm. I usually don't expect more than "emperor's new clothes" from Le Labo (very molecular fragrances mostly sculpted out of lots of musks, ambroxan, iso e super, hedione, and then a sprinkling of notes/accords that evoke the titular scent). Oftentimes, however, I am surprised that the dosing and proportions create something beautiful out of the marriage of majority synthetics and choice naturals. Case in point is their Tubereuse, which is really a souped up eau de cologne that lasts forever due to eternal white musks and has a really intriguing and appealing rubbery-tuberose aspect (just in hints...certainly not the prevailing ingredient as they allege). Rose 31 is also a brilliant transparent woody thing with just enough cumin and rosey aromachemicals to produce something truly special. This does have some of the trappings of the Tubereuse--an eau de cologne take on the "main ingredient"--but it is definitely ruined by the horrible screechy note of dihydromyrcenol...a note that evokes cheap cleansers. DHM is commonly linked to lavender and known as a booster to lavender, but for me it brings to mind grating, metallic lime. Real lavender is nowhere to be found here. I smell petitgrain more than neroli (which smell similar to me, but petitgrain smells sharper and greener to my nose), all the aforementioned molecular musks, transparent woods, and ambroxan, and some sweetness from coumarin--but definitely not a legitimate tonka bean note. This smells fresh enough, that I will keep trying it in different weather to see if the non DHM aspects shine more. It doesn't smell "bad" per se but just a disappointment.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1958529"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1958529#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1957869" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1957869" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="livani"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1293214"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="livani" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Ellis-Brooklyn/Bee-66052.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.66052.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bee"title="Bee"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1957869ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1957869" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1293214">livani</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-21">10/21/23 18:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>On my skin, this reminds me of a lighter YSL Libre. Fresh and musky, but I do understand why some would think this smells like cleaner.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1957869"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1957869#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1956208" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1956208" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="hirotino"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1780277"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1780277.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="hirotino" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1956208ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1956208" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1780277">hirotino</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-19">10/19/23 15:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>To people that thought it smelled synthetic/cleaner-esque, I thought the same when I only smelled it on paper. On my skin, WOW it smells soooooo fresh and musky. Im in love with it now. Itll be one of my go-tos for a while.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1956208"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1956208#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1956091" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
