All the last launches are WEAK and Lavande 31 is one of them.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1946898"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1946898#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1946730" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1946730" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ricenaomi"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1858749"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1858749.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ricenaomi" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1946730ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1946730" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1858749">ricenaomi</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-07">10/07/23 19:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love clean laundry scents, and this fragrance makes me smell like a warm bed. It was love at first scent, I got mines in the Vancouver store. It lasts 8 hours on me and I got compliments the whole day! People stopped me twice to ask what I was wearing and that usually never happens to me. The next day I paired it with a spritz of Gaiac 10 and TRUST ME when I say it smells HEAVENLY. That combo lasted 10 hours on me and I did a couple hours of errands/chores as well. Girlies, get your hands on this one! I also think this would make a man smell cuddly and irresistable.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1946730"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1946730#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1946486" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1946486" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ellisosb"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1058725"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="ellisosb" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Rogue-Perfumery/Fougere-L-Aube-53815.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.53815.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fougere LAube"title="Fougere LAube"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1946486ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1946486" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1058725">ellisosb</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-07">10/07/23 13:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>On my skin, this starts off citric and green, then dries down to a classic French milled soap vibe. The neroli, lavender, tonka, and musk are all there. I don't see a one-to-one comparison with any of the scents listed by previous reviewers, but it certainly has a familiar feeling. <br />
<br />
Perfectly safe. Completely inoffensive. Very well made. Not all that exciting.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1946486"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1946486#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1946317" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1946317" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="duckybubs"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1853073"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1853073.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="duckybubs" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/Tabac-28-Miami-54784.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.54784.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tabac 28 Miami"title="Tabac 28 Miami"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1946317ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1946317" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1853073">duckybubs</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-07">10/07/23 09:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lavande 31 smells like dawn dish soap if i'm being so expeditiously forreal. The dry down is reminiscent of the lingering smells of a cleaning products left in my shower after a sunday cleaning. This is a shocking October release for Le Labo because this definitely leans summer/spring. While it isnt for me, the clean girlie pops could lean into this. L31 should've been apart of the laundress x Le Labo collaboration instead of a classic collection scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1946317"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1946317#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1946104" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1946104" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Shui-Xian"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1541621"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1541621.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Shui-Xian" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Aemium/Nova-Espero-65691.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.65691.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Nova Espero"title="Nova Espero"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1946104ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1946104" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1541621">Shui-Xian</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-07">10/07/23 02:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lavender soap, clean laundry... Masculine fresh, but not overly. That is Lavande 31.<br />
<br />
Because of citrus- bergamot I am associating this fragrance with Eau des Sens (Diptyque), but Lavande is closer to the skin. Sensing it brings the impressions of purity, clean hygiene. <br />
I am a bit dissapointed by lavender. It is not dominant, although its aroma is harsh. <br />
I'd prefer sunny, natural smell of it. This composition smells cheap to me.<br />
<br />
The base is the best part, I think. Tonka adds distinctive point and there is complexity with musk and amber.<br />
<br />
Lavande 31 can gain sympathy. Wearing it is pleasant and easy, if it's enough for you.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1946104"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1946104#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1946022" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1946022" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Tannerbuhnaner"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1609945"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1609945.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Tannerbuhnaner" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1946022ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1946022" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1609945">Tannerbuhnaner</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-06">10/06/23 22:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lavande 31 is a fairly masculine and neroli, tonka, and musk fragrance the lavender is there but it is pretty subtle, and the bergamot is the same note as Bergamote 22. Drydown turns fairly creamy amber and musky over 3-4 hours. Overall it reminds me of a softer, less complex, and more musky Eternity by Calvin Klein which reminds me of my grandfather as it was his signature scent. Also similar to Bigarade 18 but more masculine. Its kinda basic but I think its a safe blind buy for any dude in your life.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1946022"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1946022#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1945152" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1945152" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="enipalellm"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1086519"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1086519.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="enipalellm" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1945152ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1945152" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1086519">enipalellm</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-05">10/05/23 20:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Bought a 1.5ml sample yesterday.<br />
Clean, very soapy lavender cocooned in a cloud of neroli. The neroli isn't too floral to me, leans green/aromatic. I get a bit of green tea vibe, too. Opens up quite loud but quickly settles close to skin. After the drydown it gets gentler and muskier. Well blended.<br />
<br />
I like it. It's nice and lovely and all but would I spend 100+ on a full bottle? Not sure. If I remember well, I think Lush has pretty similar scent (Dirty maybe?) and it costs less than 30.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1945152"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1945152#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1944741" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1944741" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Juslife01"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1651688"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1651688.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Juslife01" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1944741ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1944741" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1651688">Juslife01</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-05">10/05/23 10:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Its a neroli scent with a lavender touch. The opening reminds me of Neroli Portofino. The lavender here is quite weak. And there are some powdery notes that makes it smell like dryer sheets. I would rather see LE LABO making a new fougere than making such a generic floral scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1944741"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1944741#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1944673" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1944673" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="leatherorrisviolet"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1048023"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="leatherorrisviolet" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Paris-Hilton/Gold-Rush-Man-41567.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.41567.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gold Rush Man"title="Gold Rush Man"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1944673ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1944673" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1048023">leatherorrisviolet</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-05">10/05/23 08:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>In typical Le Labo fashion, this scent is not centered around the note it is named after. I find this to be more of a soapy and musky neroli and citrus fragrance than a lavender fragrance. Is it good? Yes, but I find it to be a spring scent and I also find it to be a little bit of a letdown. I can see this as a compliment puller, but its a little boring. Absolutely not worth the money at full retail</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1944673"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1944673#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1944550" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1944550" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="TommyBoy00"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1359392"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1359392.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="TommyBoy00" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/Musc-25-Los-Angeles-6338.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6338.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Musc 25 Los Angeles"title="Musc 25 Los Angeles"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1944550ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1944550" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1359392">TommyBoy00</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-05">10/05/23 03:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Reminds me a lot of Reflection Man by Amouage, with the typical musk present in all Le Labo perfumes. <br />
<br />
I really like it a lot, lasts quite a while and smells great. Definitely not a barbershop type fougere. In fact, I really dont get fougere from it outside of the fact it has lavender.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1944550"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1944550#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1944367" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1944367" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="HYDOBOK"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1839276"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="HYDOBOK" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Byredo/Blanche-6686.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6686.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Blanche"title="Blanche"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1944367ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1944367" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1839276">HYDOBOK</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-04">10/04/23 20:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If you're looking forward to lavender, you might be a little disappointed. The scent of Neroli is quite present,<br />
There's a little bit of aromatic vibes that are slightly present by lavender.<br />
I think the scent itself is quite good, but if the aroma vibe of lavender is more added to the scent, I think it will be better received.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1944367"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1944367#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1943997" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1943997" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mlke"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1417787"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1417787.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mlke" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1943997ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1943997" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1417787">mlke</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-04">10/04/23 10:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A big letdown if you were anticipating Le Labo doing something a little more adventurous like they've done in the past. It's certainly "nice enough", and comes across very clean and airy, eventually settling on a comfy and slightly aromatic tonka base. The other biggest thing I notice is neroli, which helps bring out the soft floral aspects of lavender, while choosing to disregard much of it's wild, herbal side. It's a very familiar scent and I feel like I've smelled it from other lavender themed barbershop scents out there. I could see it growing on me a little bit, but the imagery it inspires feels half-formed. Like they did this thing and fell asleep before finishing. Neroli, lavender, tonka. Done. It's a sleepy scent and it will definitely remind you of laundry sheets. To pick on other reviews, this certainly does not have the base of Another 13 in it. You can't just sense "clean musk" and say Another 13. It's not sour or excessively sharp and woody, nor does it have any kind of sexy sweaty thing going on. Honestly if it did I may have liked it more.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1943997"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1943997#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1943675" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1943675" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Michael62"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1212656"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1212656.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Michael62" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Imaginary-Authors/A-Whiff-of-Wafflecone-92933.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.92933.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="A Whiff of Wafflecone"title="A Whiff of Wafflecone"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1943675ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1943675" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1212656">Michael62</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-03">10/03/23 23:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Available in Australia from Mecca it might be worth checking out</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1943675"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1943675#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1943262" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1943262" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sphynxcat"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/905931"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.905931.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sphynxcat" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1943262ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1943262" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/905931">sphynxcat</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-03">10/03/23 10:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>An eau de cologne. Pretty basic neroli with a touch of herbs and lavender. Quite soapy. Goes a bit sour/soapy on me. It has a heftier base than a 4711 so if one loves 4711 but hates how fleeting it is, this might be for you as it lasts longer. The lavender is more apparent in the base, but I never get sweet or powdery, though maybe like a powdered soap kind of powdery.  <br />
Le Labo has better citrus-forward perfumes, IMO. <br />
I prefer other EDCs to this, like Cologne Indelibile or Chanel EDC. All are overpriced for what they are.<br />
Oh, if you actually wanted lavender, some reviewers already mentioned the greats from Chanel, Lutens, Caron, etc.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1943262"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1943262#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1943024" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1943024" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="spirit966"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/37849"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="spirit966" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Feve-Gourmande-87746.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.87746.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fve Gourmande"title="Fve Gourmande"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1943024ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1943024" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/37849">spirit966</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-03">10/03/23 04:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Not a fougere, not a barbershop frag. <br />
<br />
The opening is Bergamonte 22 + a huge dose of neroli that transitions to a pure lavender mid, and dries down to the base of Another 13. <br />
<br />
An ok fragrance that is right in the middle unisex.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1943024"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1943024#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1942371" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1942371" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Mickyscents"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1252225"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1252225.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Mickyscents" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1942371ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1942371" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1252225">Mickyscents</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-02">10/02/23 07:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Bought a sample yesterday as I am lucky to have a store thats not far from where I live. Its a beautiful barbershop fragrance with the Lavender being front and center (which is kinda odd for Le Labo iykyk). As the fragrance dries down the lavender is still there accompanied by bergamot and Tonka. The Tonka makes the fragrance more warm than the barbershop frags Im used to which I love!! Its a nice scent, nothing groundbreaking but I will definitely continue to enjoy my sample.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1942371"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1942371#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1942258" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1942258" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Paint86"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/884554"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.884554.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Paint86" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Etat-Libre-d-Orange/Une-Amourette-Roland-Mouret-46517.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.46517.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Une Amourette Roland Mouret"title="Une Amourette Roland Mouret"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1942258ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1942258" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/884554">Paint86</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-02">10/02/23 04:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>When doing a Lavender now, or lets say a fougere, brands have a few options. Trying something new and pushing the genre in new territories, serving as a clever tribute to lavender classics with a few additions, or simply redoing whats already been done 100 times and sticking a new name on the label.<br />
<br />
I was hoping Le Labo would go for the former option, and Le Labo a few years ago might have. <br />
<br />
What we are presented with here, in my humble opinion, is a nod to the way Lavender was done in mainstream perfumery in the 90s. I was immediately reminded of Calvin Klein Eternity, and of countless other ultra-clean, borderline detergent-like fragrances. Its VERY clean, and yes, you will smell like your clothes JUST came out of the wash. The lavender/neroli mix is pretty, but too artificial-smelling for me, and it dries down to a lavender/musk/slight tonka mix which has been down 100 times (and better) in recent years. Nothing new under the sun. <br />
<br />
In short  its not the one for me, and Le Labo has not released something appealing to me since Baie 19 and Tonka 25. <br />
<br />
If youre after this smell almost exactly, you can find it for considerably cheaper with Eternity. If you are after a brand taking a well-known ingredient  lavender  and doing something clever with it whilst respecting prestigious elders, look for  as mentioned by Liamsardea below - Chanels Boy or Celines Rimbaud. Or.. well, Pour un Homme is still around, isnt it?</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1942258"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1942258#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1941485" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1941485" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="teh"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1371398"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1371398.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="teh" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Pur-Oud-66436.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.66436.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Pur Oud"title="Pur Oud"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1941485ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1941485" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1371398">teh</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-01">10/01/23 00:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>bro be launching 2 perfumes in a year and both are cashgrabs.. this smells like some random Zara men perfumes - cheap and generic, slapped over the typical lelabo musk (aka Another 13) not sure why it gets such a high rating lol?! well I guess Le labo we know has gone </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1941485"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1941485#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1939266" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1939266" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Liamsardea"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/802447"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.802447.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Liamsardea" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Caron/Yatagan-4024.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4024.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Yatagan"title="Yatagan"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1939266ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1939266" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/802447">Liamsardea</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-28">09/28/23 05:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Le Labo says Lavande, I say Neroli! The lavender is present albeit dominated by an orange blossom note - whether you find this distracting or not will be up to your tolerance levels, but I personally bemoan Le Labos nominal trickery where what you read is not what you get. It feels disingenuous to me. Lavande blankets its floral-lavender tones in creamy white musk. It is not a fougere, but a floral.<br />
<br />
Save your money: buy Jersey, Boy, Pour Un Homme, 1725, Eau Noire, Masculin Pluriel, Serges lavender trio (Encens et Lavande, Fourreau Noir, Gris Clair) or seek the now discontinued and very beautiful Brin de Reglisse. <br />
<br />
Sincerely, a lavender lover.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1939266"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1939266#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1932773" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1932773" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jgroves992"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1739494"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1739494.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jgroves992" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jo-Malone-London/Birch-Black-Pepper-51683.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.51683.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Birch & Black Pepper"title="Birch & Black Pepper"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1932773ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1932773" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1739494">Jgroves992</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-20">09/20/23 10:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>So I tried this in the store today and what I can say is thats its not anything like a classic fougere, atleast in the beginning. The more it dries down the more lavender starts to come out but it starts out as a fresh and clean bergamot/neroli/lavender combo. In the end it turns into a more powdery lavender with heavy musk. I enjoy it quite a bit and its nice to see le labo have something a little more complex with lots of transitions.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1932773"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1932773#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1930260" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1930260" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="haywirelibran"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1328503"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="haywirelibran" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/Gaiac-10-Tokyo-6335.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6335.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gaiac 10 Tokyo"title="Gaiac 10 Tokyo"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1930260ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1930260" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1328503">haywirelibran</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-17">09/17/23 10:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I've actually smelled this at Le Labo store in France, because they had just prepared it and it wasn't on the shelf, but since I asked about it, they let me smell it and test it on my skin. It was nice, but all I could think of was Raid Anti-Moth capsules, so in a way it smelled generic and dare I say cheap.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1930260"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1930260#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1905202" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1523286">s.may_h</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-18">08/18/23 07:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Beautiful combination of all my favourite notes!  Looking forward to this new release!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1905202"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1905202#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1904904" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1904904" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Riverwind79"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1260786"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1260786.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Riverwind79" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Egoiste-Platinum-614.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.614.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Egoiste Platinum"title="Egoiste Platinum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1904904ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x0"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1904904" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1260786">Riverwind79</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-17">08/17/23 21:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Looking at the notes I does reminds of MFK's Petit Matin. I'm so looking forward to try this out. :)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1904904"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1904904#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1904822" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1904822" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LauraVTerrazas"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1404949"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1404949.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LauraVTerrazas" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Patchouli-Absolu-28009.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.28009.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Patchouli Absolu"title="Patchouli Absolu"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1904822ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1904822" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1404949">LauraVTerrazas</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-17">08/17/23 18:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I normally don't comment on fragrances that haven't launched but I'm very excited for this! <br />
I've been on the hunt for a lavender scent. <br />
Celine Rimbaud has been a contender for some time and Penhaligon's just released a scent called A Balm of Calm that I also adore. Since I'm a Le Labo fan, I'm going to hold off until I get my nose on this. Super duper excited! <br />
<br />
Edit: I purchased the 15mL. Holy smokes, the opening is very much neroli and then it dries down to a more neroli/amber profile with a powder nuance. It's reminding me of something I've smelled before. Perhaps a blend of multiple fragrances  but I can't put my finger on it. <br />
Lavender is very much in the background to play a supportive role and not the main character... typical. Le Labo sure knows how to do that...  and yet I'm still a fanatic of the house <br />
Anyway, this is unisex leaning more feminine  (my husband agrees). I'd categorize this scent as a "clean, laundry scent perfume" to be worn casually during the day. I actually really like this! It's definitely not "the one" when it comes to lavender scents but it's still a good one. For full transparency, I don't think I'll upgrade to a bigger bottle.  Successful blind buy nonetheless!<br />
<br />
So, I previously mentioned Rimbaud and A Balm of Calm, right? Here's what I'm thinking:<br />
<br />
*Rimbaud*: true lavender scent with a powdery base.<br />
*A Balm of Calm*: your playful sweeter lavender<br />
*Lavande 31*: your clean lavender neroli scent for warm weather</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1904822"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1904822#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                    </div>
</div>

padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1695584">reesefernando</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-10">11/10/23 22:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Beautiful scent! Upon spraying this, I immediately smelled my top 3 favorite notes - lavender, neroli and bergamot - so it was a no-brainer buy for me. It is a fresh, happy and relaxing scent, which reminds me of weekend mornings when I have no work stress to think about and I can be myself all day. At the drydown, the lavender becomes more apparent in a soapy skin scent way and the tonka beans kick in to add a calming vibe. Gorgeous! Projection and longevity are both good and way better than my Le Labo fave Another 13. <br />
<br />
I was really surprised to see low ratings and bad reviews for this but as a freshie lover, this has easily climbed to my shelf of favorites and blind reach bottles.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; <br />

<br />

*A Balm of Calm*: your playful sweeter lavender<br />
*Lavande 31*: your clean lavender neroli scent for warm weather</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1904822"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1904822#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1994089" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1994089" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ButterGoose"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1917307"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="ButterGoose" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1994089ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1994089" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1917307">ButterGoose</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-06">12/06/23 11:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Received a sample of this and really didnt think much, but then I kept catching irresistible notes of it throughout the day and I was hooked. I ordered a 50ml bottle which arrived within a couple of days. I decided to wear it to work and have never received more compliments and questions about what I was wearing. While perfumes are very subjective and project differently on different people, this one really works on me; it projects well without being too strong and lasts for hours. Its clean and comforting, yet a bit sexy and intriguing. I own Santal 33, Rose 31, Lys 41 and Neroli 36- none come close to the perfection of Lavande 31</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="1994089"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=1994089#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2011325" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2011325" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="consuelle"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1709321"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1709321.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="consuelle" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Xerjoff/Apollonia-55970.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.55970.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Apollonia"title="Apollonia"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2011325ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2011325" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1709321">consuelle</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-26">12/26/23 14:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I've been so obsessed with this fragrance since the first sniff. I finally got the full size for my birthday and since then I've been wearing it nonstop. It is super clean and perfect as a signature everyday wear. I'm not a huge fan of lavender but this is such a special lavender mixed with neroli and musk that I just got hooked on this one. My first Le Labo scent and can't wait to get to smell the next one.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84249"comment_id="2011325"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lavande-31-84249.html?ccid=2011325#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="84249" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-negative-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Negative Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
